name: IR RGB LED CONTROLLER
tagline: Control RGB LED remotely with an Arduino and IR Remote
body:
> ### IR Controlled Arduino RGB LED Controller
> Use this coded to recieve IR from any Remote Input, and use it to control different mode's and colors of the RGB LED. This is mainly used with a ULN2003A or its brother ULN2803A to control High Power 12v RGB LED Strips. 

## Different Mode's Available - 
* mdPulse
* mdSolid
* mdRandomFade
* mdRainbow
* mdStrobe, with fade option for every mode. 

```
$ cd rohinrohn/IR_RGB_CONTROLLER
$ git fetch rohinrohin
$ git checkout gh-pages
```

If you're using the GitHub for Mac, simply sync your repository and you'll see the new branch.
### 
### Prerequisites
* Arduino IDE
* Arduino Uno? Or any other Arduino Compatible
* IRremote Library
* SerialCommand Library, if you want Serial Command Input
* RGB LED, to test it

### Authors and Contributors
**Main Contributor - Rohin Gopalakrishnan(@rohinrohin)**
_A big Thanks goes to Martin Eberhardt DarkFox(@DarkFox) for his base RGB LED Controller, and Shirriff for his amazing IRremote Reciever Code. _

### Support or Contact
Feel free to contact me on my mail (rohinrohin@gmail.com) or on twitter(@rohinrohin).

Having trouble with Pages? Check out the documentation at http://help.github.com/pages or contact support@github.com and weâ€™ll help you sort it out.
